comment: Lemma for ~ sqrt2irr . This is the core of the proof: if ` A / B = sqrt ( 2 ) ` , then ` A ` and ` B ` are even, so ` A / 2 ` and ` B / 2 ` are smaller representatives, which is absurd by the method of infinite descent (here implemented by strong induction). This is Metamath 100 proof #1. (Contributed by NM, 20-Aug-2001.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-Sep-2015.) (Proof shortened by JV, 4-Jan-2022.)
